While STRONG training infrastructure and Epic implementation are confirmed, the absence of VILT confirmation (current model is instructor-led with physical seats) and zero active hiring signals prevent Tier A assignment.

accounts.evidence_summary: Intermountain Healthcare demonstrates STRONG training qualification signals with a mandatory Epic EHR training program scheduled June-August 2025 featuring role-specific pathways for physicians, nurses, and APPs across 63,000 employees. The organization has invested in dedicated training infrastructure including Cloud-CME LMS (intermountain.cloud-cme.com) integrated with Workday, YAROOMS platform for seat management, and ACCME/ANCC-accredited continuing education programs. Phase II evidence from Scout preliminary findings confirms Epic 8.7.25 implementation with training tracks for versions 8.6-8.14. The primary competitive opportunity is transitioning from instructor-led delivery with physical seat constraints to virtual classroom capabilities that can scale training delivery across multiple clinical disciplines while maintaining accreditation requirements.

accounts.tier_rationale: Texas Health Resources qualifies as Tier A based on STRONG training evidence and confirmed VILT capabilities. The organization operates Texas Health Resources University (THRU) LMS with 4,500+ online learning opportunities, maintains a dedicated healthcare education portal at ce.texashealth.org, and has explicitly shifted to virtual training delivery with 21 developed virtual modules for employee onboarding. VILT confirmation elevates this to Tier A priority despite   EHR status.

accounts.tier_rationale: San Mateo Medical Center qualifies as Tier B with STRONG training evidence and STRONG EHR evidence. The organization operates a dedicated Education & Training department with Cornerstone OnDemand LMS serving 5000 employees, contractors, travelers, and providers with mandatory training programs (https://www.smchealth.org/smmc-education-training). They recently completed Epic go-live on November 2, 2024, with FY 2025-26 marking the next wave of Epic implementation expansion (https://performance.smcgov.org/stories/s/Electronic-Health-Record-8420B-/cj57-rs44/). While VILT is not currently confirmed, the combination of established training infrastructure, recent EHR implementation, and planned expansion creates a qualified opportunity.

accounts.tier_rationale: Penn State Health qualifies as Tier B based on STRONG training evidence from Phase II validation. The organization operates multiple comprehensive training programs including ACCME-accredited continuing education, Earn While You Learn paid programs, Graduate Nurse Residency (yearlong paid program), EMT apprenticeship (8-week paid program), and multiple 6-12 week trainee programs across clinical roles. Phase III enrichment confirms active Epic implementation (negotiations Sept 2024, AI suite adoption Nov 2025, new CIO Nov 2025) with 70+ facilities requiring training support, providing significant timing urgency for VILT solutions.
